article.headline: VMI 92, Winthrop 74
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. -- Keith Gabriel scored a game-high 25 points to lead Virginia Military Institute to a 92-74 win over Winthrop in both teams' Big South Conference opener Wednesday night. The Keydets (5-2, 1-0) received 23 points from Austin Kenon and 21 from Travis Holmes. Holmes also added seven rebounds, seven assists and four steals for VMI. The Eagles (1-6, 0-1) were led in scoring by Justin Burton and Cameron Stanley with 18 points each. Charles Corbin chipped in 16 points and eight rebounds. The Keydets shot 39 percent from 3-point range (16-for-41). Winthrop outrebounded VMI 45-33, but turned the ball over 25 times.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
